intro: Clinopodium helianthemifolium, commonly known as meadow basil or mountain thyme, is a small herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Clinopodium helianthemifolium is often found in sunny, well-drained soils in meadows and rocky habitats.
